pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.base

Class AbstractServerEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.base.AbstractServerEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationAware, ServerEngine

    public abstract class AbstractServerEngine
extends Object
implements ServerEngine
    This class is intended to be extended by more specific Websocket Engine implementations. It provides an access to Websocket Engine configuration as well as Bristleback configuration. It also fully implements connection open/close events, which are sent by the connectors.

    Created on: 2011-07-09 16:13:41

    Author:
    Wojciech Niemiec

      • onConnectionOpened

        public void onConnectionOpened(WebsocketConnector connector)
        Description copied from interface: ServerEngine
        When a new connection is established, a newly created connector invokes this callback method to signal server engine. Engine should always run ConnectionStateListenerChain.connectorStarted() method.
        Specified by:
        onConnectionOpened in interface ServerEngine
        Parameters:
        connector - newly created connector representing established client connection.

      • onConnectionClose

        public void onConnectionClose(WebsocketConnector connector)
        Description copied from interface: ServerEngine
        This callback method is called by a connector when connection with client is closed. Connection might be closed for several reasons:
        • Connection is closed by client side
        • Connection is closed because maximum idle time is exceeded.
        • Connection is closed by sending closing server message using ConditionObjectSender.
        Engine should always run ConnectionStateListenerChain.connectorStopped() method.
        Specified by:
        onConnectionClose in interface ServerEngine
        Parameters:
        connector - object representing connection with client.
